column3: Meaning
Comment
IF statement declaration/enclosure
DO statement declaration/enclosure
Case statement declaration/branches
Register Content
Content of address specified in register
ES:[DI] indicates the contents of the location whose ES segment relative address is in register DI.
[SI] indicates the contents of the address contained in register SI relative to the SI register’s
default segment (DS) or the overridden segment.
Parentheses around the “E” in a general-purpose register name, such as (E)SI, indicates that the offset is read
from the SI register if the address-size attribute is 16, from the ESI register if the address-size attribute is 32.
Parentheses around the “R” in a general-purpose register name, (R)SI, in the presence of a 64-bit register
definition such as (R)SI, indicates that the offset is read from the 64-bit RSI register if the address-size
attribute is 64
Brackets are used for memory operands where they mean that the contents of the memory location is a
segment-relative offset. For example, [SRC] indicates that the content of the source operand is a segment-
relative offset.
The value of B is assigned to A.
Compares two values for equality; A = B is TRUE if the value of A is equal to B; otherwise it is FALSE.
Compares two values for inequality
The destination operand should be shifted left by the number of bits indicated by the count operand.
The destination operand should be shifted  right by the number of bits indicated by the count operand.
